newsitem.title: INDIA: India HCL, Deluxe sign joint venture pact.
newsitem.headline: India HCL, Deluxe sign joint venture pact.

text.p: India's HCL Corp on Monday signed a joint venture agreement with Deluxe Corp of the United States to provide electronic banking services in India, South East Asia and the United States.
The decision to form the joint venture, called HCL Deluxe Ltd, was first announced in August by Deluxe in New York.

"Targeting the rapidly growing sectors of banking, insurance, capital markets and non-banking finance companies, HCL Deluxe will provide a broad range of electronic banking capabilities," HCL Corp said in a statement released in the Indian capital
HCL Corp chairman Shiv Nadar said the new venture will have initial equity capital of $30 million. Each partner will have a 50 percent stake.
The joint venture will provide state-of-the-art payment system products and services to upgrade and automate India's banking and financial services industry, it said.
Deluxe is one of the leaders in the integrated payment systems in the United States, the statement said.
